snippet: The government of Laos said on Tuesday that it would build a huge hydroelectric dam on the Mekong River despite concerns that it could do irreparable damage to the environment.
abstract: Laos, ignoring criticism that huge hydroelectric dam could irreparably damage ecology of the Mekong River, says it is pushing ahead with the multibillion-dollar project, first dam to be built on lower portion of the iconic river; electricity from the project will be sold to Thailand and will provide billions of dollars of revenue to Laos, one of the poorest countries in Asia.

byline.original: By THOMAS FULLER and POYPITI AMATATHAM

lead_paragraph: The government of Laos said on Tuesday that it would build a huge hydroelectric dam on the Mekong River despite concerns that it could do irreparable damage to the environment.

headline.seo: Laos to Proceed With Mekong Dam Project
headline.main: Laos Presses Ahead With Mekong Dam Project
headline.print_headline: Laos to Proceed With Dam Project on Mekong River
